name: 梁曉帆
objective: This course provides an overview of the basic concepts of decision theory and their applications on the real-world decision problems. Students will learn about the problem identification and modeling, the modeling and estimation of the associated uncertainty, and modeling and evaluation of the utility function.
schedule:
Week 1: Introduction
Week 2: No class (Moon Festival)
Week 3: Elements of decision problems
Week 4: Structuring decisions
Week 5: Making choices
Week 6: Sensitivity analysis
Week 7: Creativity and decision making
Week 8: Probability basics
Week 9: Mid-term exam
Week 10: Subjective probability
Week 11: Theoretical probability models
Week 12: Using data/Monte Carlo simulation
Week 13: Value of Information
Week 14: Risk attitudes
Week 15: Utility axioms, paradoxes, and implications
Week 16: Conflicting objectives I
Week 17: Conflicting objectives II
Week 18: Final exam
materials: Making hard decisions with DeccisionTools (2001) by Clemen and Reilly, Duxbury (雙葉)
